medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had classic migraine headaches with visual aura since age 11. In the past few months, symptoms progressed to more severe and frequent migraine attacks with left side hemiparesis and eyelid ptosis. She experienced two episodes of left hemiparetic migraine headaches per day, each lasting 3 to 4 hours with significant weakness during the attacks.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother had migraine headaches at a young age, and her sister had severe migraine attacks with hemiparesis a few years ago.
